items.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
items.summary: CISA has added one new vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation. CVE-2025-55182 Meta React Server Components Remote Code Execution Vulnerability This type of vulnerability is a frequent attack vector for malicious cyber actors and poses significant risks to the federal enterprise. Binding Operational Directive (BOD) 22-01: Reducing the Significant Risk of Known Exploited Vulnerabilities established the KEV Catalog as a living li

items.title: Johnson Controls OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace
items.summary: View CSAF 1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY CVSS v4 6.5 ATTENTION: Exploitable remotely/low attack complexity Vendor: Johnson Controls Inc. Equipment: OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace Vulnerability: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing') 2. RISK EVALUATION Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to sensitive information. 3. items.title: BRICKSTORM Backdoor
items.summary: Malware Analysis at a Glance Executive Summary The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), National Security Agency (NSA), and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (Cyber Centre) assess People’s Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored cyber actors are using BRICKSTORM malware for long-term persistence on victim systems. CISA, NSA, and Cyber Centre are releasing this Malware Analysis Report to share indicators of compromise (IOCs) and detection signatures based off analysis of eigh

items.title: CISA Releases Nine Industrial Control Systems Advisories
items.summary: CISA released nine Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Advisories. These advisories provide timely information about current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS. ICSA-25-338-01 Mitsubishi Electric GX Works2 ICSA-25-338-02 MAXHUB Pivot ICSA-25-338-03 Johnson Controls OpenBlue Mobile Web Application for OpenBlue Workplace ICSA-25-338-04 Johnson Controls iSTAR ICSA-25-338-05 Sunbird DCIM dcTrack and Power IQ ICSA-25-338-06 SolisCloud Monitoring Platform ICSA-25-338-07 Advant

items.summary: View CSAF 1. RISK EVALUATION Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to request a password reset and gain unauthorized access to the account. 3. items.title: Daily Briefing: Cybersecurity threats and defense strategies
items.summary: Today's edition covers emerging cybersecurity threats, nation-state activities, ransomware trends, and the latest security advisories. Key topics include critical vulnerabilities in enterprise software, ongoing disinformation campaigns, and defense strategies for organizations. Industry experts weigh in on the evolving threat landscape and best practices for maintaining robust security postures in an increasingly connected world.

items.title: Research Saturday: Advanced persistent threat analysis
items.summary: This week's research deep-dive examines sophisticated attack methodologies employed by state-sponsored actors. Security researchers discuss attribution challenges, infrastructure analysis, and defensive countermeasures. The episode features detailed technical breakdowns of recent campaigns and provides actionable intelligence for security teams.

items.title: Cybersecurity news roundup: Week in review
items.summary: A comprehensive summary of this week's most significant cybersecurity developments. Coverage includes major data breaches, regulatory updates, threat actor activity, security patches, and industry analysis. The roundup aggregates insights from across the security community to help professionals stay informed about the rapidly evolving cyber landscape.

items.title: Hacking Humans: Social engineering tactics exposed
items.summary: An exploration of current social engineering techniques targeting organizations and individuals. This episode discusses phishing campaigns, business email compromise schemes, and psychological manipulation tactics. Security awareness experts provide guidance on identifying and mitigating these human-centric attacks.

items.title: Daily Briefing: Zero-day vulnerabilities and patch priorities
items.summary: Critical security updates and newly discovered vulnerabilities dominate today's briefing. Security teams are advised to prioritize patching efforts for actively exploited flaws affecting enterprise infrastructure. The briefing includes exploit timelines, vendor responses, and risk assessments to help organizations make informed decisions about their security posture.

items.title: CyberWire Pro: Threat intelligence briefing
items.summary: An executive-level briefing on current cyber threats impacting critical infrastructure and enterprise operations. This report synthesizes intelligence from multiple sources to provide strategic insights into adversary capabilities, tactics, and targets. Leaders receive actionable recommendations for enhancing organizational resilience.

items.title: Caveat: Policy and legal implications of cyber operations
items.summary: A discussion of the legal and policy dimensions surrounding cybersecurity and cyber warfare. Topics include international law, attribution challenges, proportionality in cyber responses, and emerging regulatory frameworks. Legal experts and policy analysts provide context for understanding the evolving rules of engagement in cyberspace.

items.title: Daily Briefing: Ransomware operations and mitigation
items.summary: Analysis of recent ransomware campaigns affecting healthcare, education, and government sectors. Security researchers detail attack vectors, encryption methods, and recovery options. The briefing emphasizes the importance of backup strategies, incident response planning, and cross-sector information sharing to combat the ransomware epidemic.

items.title: Industry voices: CISO perspectives on emerging challenges
items.summary: Leading Chief Information Security Officers share their insights on navigating today's complex threat environment. Discussions cover workforce challenges, budget constraints, board-level communication, and strategic planning. CISOs from various industries offer practical advice for peers facing similar challenges in protecting their organizations.
